verses.roman:
prabhāṣyaivaṁ dadau vidyāṁ
pradyumnāya mahātmane
māyāvatī mahā-māyāṁ
sarva-māyā-vināśinīm

synonyms: prabhāṣya—speaking; evam—thus; dadau—gave; vidyām—mystic knowledge; pradyumnāya—to Pradyumna; mahā-ātmane—the great soul; māyāvatī—Māyāvatī; mahā-māyām—known as Mahā-māyā; sarva—all; māyā—deluding spells; vināśinīm—which destroys.
translation: [Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued:] Speaking thus, Māyāvatī gave to the great soul Pradyumna the mystic knowledge called Mahāmāyā, which vanquishes all other deluding spells.
